archetype_name: Family Weekend Showstopper: Spanish & Portuguese Feasts
name: Portuguese Peri-Peri Butterflied Chicken with Roast Garlic Potatoes and Grilled Padrón Peppers
description: A showpiece peri-peri butterflied chicken grilled over flames, served with lemon-garlic roast potatoes and blistered Padrón peppers. Slow, hands-on cooking for a memorable Iberian family feast.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C (430°F). Preheat Outdoor Grill to medium-high, two-zone heat.
Rinse and pat dry the butterflied chicken.
Peel and slice onions into thick rings. Peel and cut potatoes into 2–3 cm chunks.
Finely chop garlic. Roughly chop parsley. Halve lemon and cut extra wedges.
In a bowl, mix peri-peri sauce, peri-peri spice blend, olive oil, paprika, salt, and black pepper to make a marinade.
Toss potatoes and onions with olive oil, garlic, salt, and black pepper on a roasting tray.
Drizzle Padrón peppers with olive oil and season with salt for grilling later.
cook_steps: Marinate chicken: Rub the peri-peri marinade all over the butterflied chicken, including under the skin. Squeeze lemon over and let sit 20–30 minutes.
Start potatoes: Roast the potato and onion tray on the middle rack for 20 minutes.
Grill chicken (skin side up first): Place chicken over indirect heat, close lid, and grill 20 minutes.

Flip chicken skin-side down over direct heat to crisp 5–7 minutes, watching for flare-ups. Move back to indirect heat, close lid, and cook 15–25 minutes more until juices run clear (thickest part reaches 74°C/165°F).
Finish potatoes: Toss potatoes with parsley and a little olive oil; continue roasting until golden and tender (total 40–50 minutes).
Grill Padrón peppers: Just before serving, grill peppers over direct heat 3–4 minutes, turning until blistered and tender. Season with a pinch of salt.
Rest chicken 10 minutes on a board. Carve into halves, then portions.
Serve: Plate chicken with roast potatoes and onions, add blistered Padrón peppers, and offer lemon wedges for squeezing.

ingredients.preparation: divided for marinade, potatoes, and peppers
1 juiced for marinade, 1 cut into wedges
